$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Image result for app for download

p.span: The GCSSD app is available now for free download in the Apple App Store and the Google Play Store. This mobile app is powered by Blackboard, formally Parentlink and integrates with all the school tools you need—from websites, social media, and mass notifications---for a more streamlined communication experience.

This GCSSD app offers students, parents, and anyone interested in the Gibson County Special District access to a comprehensive suite of apps developed to provide timely and helpful school and district information. The app provides tools like lunch menus and calendars. It also provides access to critical student information including password protected parent access to student attendance, grades, progress reports, and assignments through the PowerSchool app. You will have access to sports’ rosters, schedules, and scores as they are updated. Throughout the year, the app will grow with more features and more services that will be useful to the students, parents, staff, and community.

a.title: Go to comments for Download the New GCSSD App!

p.span: Please click on the link below to download a copy of the 2019-20 district-wide calendar.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.title: Go to comments for Equal Opportunity

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: As you are aware, Governor Bill Lee recommended that schools close for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year due to the continuous spread of COVID-19. Gibson County Special School District will follow this recommendation. Click here for more information on continuing distance learning, grades, and other district-wide information.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19: District Update

div.p: GCSSD believes that it is very important to recognize you and celebrate your hard work and to share that experience with your families and friends. We continue to hold out hope that we will be able to hold graduation ceremonies at SGCHS on May 14 at 7 P.M. and at GCHS on May 15 at 6 P.M. If we are unable to hold graduation in May, we have set alternative tentative dates.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19: Graduation

div.p: One of these emergency rules is that students shall receive no grade lower than the grade they earned in the course as of March 16, 2020; however, GCSSD can provide remote learning opportunities to students as an opportunity to improve the student’s grade.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19: Grade Explanation

img.alt: Meal Delivery and/or grab and go icon

div.p: No cost meals available for children 18 and under. Meals are provided for multiple days every Monday and Thursday through May 18th. We encourage our families to pick up meals between 11:00am and 12:30pm at any of our food distribution sites located at the following schools: Kenton, Rutherford, Dyer, Spring Hill, Yorkville, and SGCES.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19: District Meal Service

div.p: Parents, family members, school staff, and other trusted adults can play an important role in helping students make sense of what they hear in a way that is honest, accurate, and minimizes anxiety. If your child needs extra support during these trying times, please contact your school principal and/or counselor by email.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19: Mental Health Services

div.p: Parent/Student Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) Guide. If you have questions, you can reach out to your child’s teacher and/or principal. You are also welcome to email the Director of Schools at epruett@gcssd.org or call 731-483-9113.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19: Parent/Student FAQ

div.p: TN state-wide resource guide for parents, families, and teens.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19: Resources

a.span: COVID-19: Temporary attendance and exam policy changes

div.p: Due to recent guidance from the Department of Health, GCSSD will be adjusting its policies regarding perfect attendnace and exam exemption for high school.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19: Temporary attendance and exam policy changes

div.p: Student and Teacher calendar for the 2020-21 SY is now available!

a.title: Go to comments for 2020-21 SY Calendar Released

a.span: GCSSD Music Education Program Receives National Recognition

div.p: Gibson County Special School District has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education.

a.title: Go to comments for GCSSD Music Education Program Receives National Recognition

div.p: Due to recent legislation, we have updated our district-wide attendance policy

a.title: Go to comments for Attendance Policy Change

div.p: Spring Hill School Safe Room, Hazard Mitigation Application

a.title: Go to comments for Public Notice

div.p:
Address PO Box 60
130 Trenton Highway
Dyer, TN 38330, ,

div.span: This is the official website of Gibson County Special School District. The material contained within the electronic pages of the GCSSD Website is for use of the school district community. We make every effort to ensure that no offensive or inappropriate material will be published on the site; however, we have no control over the constantly changing landscape of the Internet. If you see questionable material on this site or any linked sites, please contact the school district.
